problem:
Solve
\[\frac{(x + 7)(x - 2)}{x - 1} < 0.\]Enter your answer using interval notation.
solution:
We can build a sign chart:

\[
\begin{array}{c|cccc}
& x < -7 & -7 < x < 1 & 1 < x < 2 & 2 < x \\ \hline
x + 7 & - & + & + & + \\
x - 1 & - & - & + & + \\
x - 2 & - & - & - & + \\
\frac{(x + 7)(x - 2)}{x - 1} & - & + & - & +
\end{array}
\]Thus, the solution is $x \in \boxed{(-\infty,-7) \cup (1,2)}.$
